com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Class ActivityController

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.ActivityController

public final class ActivityController
extends java.lang.Object

Is responsible for intercepting an activity starting and redirect it to a prerequisite one if necessary, and for handling globally exceptions.

Everything described here which involves the activities, is applicable provided the activity is a SmartableActivity.

It is also a container for multiple interfaces relative to its architecture.

Since:
2009.04.28
Author:
Édouard Mercier

Nested Class Summary
static class ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler
          A simple implementation of ActivityController.ExceptionHandler which pops-up error dialog boxes and toasts.
static interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
          Defines and splits the handling of various exceptions in a single place.
static interface ActivityController.Interceptor
          An interface which is queried during the various life cycle events of an activity.
static interface ActivityController.Redirector
          An interface which is requested when a new Activity is bound to be started.
 
Field Summary
static java.lang.String CALLING_INTENT
          When a new activity is started because of a redirection, the newly started activity will receive the initial activity Intent through this Parcelable key.

Field Detail

CALLING_INTENT

public static final java.lang.String CALLING_INTENT
When a new activity is started because of a redirection, the newly started activity will receive the initial activity Intent through this Parcelable key.

See Also:
needsRedirection(Activity), #registerInterceptor(ActivityController. Interceptor), Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getInstance

public static ActivityController getInstance()
The only way to access to the activity controller.

getExceptionHandler

public ActivityController.ExceptionHandler getExceptionHandler()

registerRedirector

public void registerRedirector(ActivityController.Redirector redirector)
Remembers the activity redirector that will be used by the framework, before starting a new Activity.

Parameters:
redirector - the redirector that will be requested at runtime, when a new activity is being started; if null, then, redirection mechanism will be set up

registerInterceptor

public void registerInterceptor(ActivityController.Interceptor interceptor)
Remembers the activity interceptor that will be used by the framework, on every event during the underlying Activity life cycle.

Parameters:
interceptor - the interceptor that will be invoked at runtime, on every event; if null, no interception mechanism will be used

registerExceptionHandler

public void registerExceptionHandler(ActivityController.ExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
Remembers the exception handler that will be used by the framework.

Parameters:
exceptionHandler - the handler that will be invoked in case of exception; if null, no exception handler will be used

onLifeCycleEvent

public void onLifeCycleEvent(android.app.Activity activity,
                             ActivityController.Interceptor.InterceptorEvent event)
Is invoked by the framework every time a life cycle event occurs for the provided activity. You should not invoke that method yourself!

Note that the method is synchronized, which means that the previous call will block the next one, if no thread is spawn.

Parameters:
activity - the activity which is involved with the event
event - the event that has just happened for that activity

handleException

public boolean handleException(android.content.Context context,
                               java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Dispatches the exception to the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler, and invokes the right method depending on its nature.

The framework is responsible for invoking that method every time an unhandled exception is thrown. If no exception handler is registered, the exception will be only logged, and the method will return false.

Parameters:
context - the context that originated the exception ; may be null
throwable - the reported exception
Returns:
true if the exception has been handled ; in particular, if no exception handled has been set, returns false

needsRedirection

public boolean needsRedirection(android.app.Activity activity)
Indicates whether a redirection is required before letting the activity continue its life cycle. Also launches the redirected Activity is a redirection is need, and provide to its Intent the initial activity Intent trough the extra Parcelable CALLING_INTENT key.

Parameters:
activity - the activity which is being proved against the ActivityController.Redirector
Returns:
true if and only if the given activity should be paused (or ended) and if another activity should be launched instead
